issue.title: error parsing nested varibles

body:
That's not enough info. Read the bug and give an example of it not working
and exactly what the error is.

The error you mention occurs when the argument is not a string - what is
it? If its already a colour you need not pass it in.

@srikanthmanian Your example works fine in on http://less2css.org in LESS 1.3.3 , 1.4 and 1.4.1.

The error you're getting must be happening elsewhere since it refers about the `color()` function, not the color attribute or a variable with color in the name.

Which LESS watcher are you using? Do you know what version of LESS it's actually using?

I just tested your example with two files using LESS 1.3.0 _and_ 1.4.2 from the command line and I compiled the style.less file using:

```
lessc styles.less
```

The output was as expected:

``` css
a {
  color: #1a1a1a;
}
```

My mistake. Was assigning color code value rather than string value to custom gradient mixin. But inspite of this, the error was being shown at a completely different line number. Maybe this needs to be checked. Thanks everyone.
